conclusion: To determine the acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds, we can use the slope of the velocity-time (v-t) graph. The slope of the v-t graph represents the acceleration.
At t = 1 second, the velocity is 2 m/s.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity is -2 m/s.

premise: At t = 1 second, the velocity is 2 m/s. At t = 3 seconds, the velocity is -2 m/s.
conclusion: Δv = v_final - v_initial = (-2 m/s) - (2 m/s) = -4 m/s
The time interval is from 1 second to 3 seconds.

premise: The time interval is from 1 second to 3 seconds.
conclusion: Δt = t_final - t_initial = 3 s - 1 s = 2 s
a = Δv / Δt = -4 m/s / 2 s = -2 m/s²
